content.title: Planck Volume: The Quantum of Three-Dimensional Space
content.abstract: The Planck volume V_P = ℓ_P³ ≈ 4.22 × 10⁻¹⁰⁵ m³ is the characteristic volume scale where quantum gravitational effects become dominant. It represents the smallest volume that can be meaningfully probed and may represent a minimum eigenvalue for the volume operator in loop quantum gravity.

statement.text: The Planck volume is the cube of the Planck length, representing the characteristic volume scale at which quantum gravity effects dominate geometry.

explanation.intuition: If the Planck length ℓ_P is the 'pixel size' of space, then the Planck volume is the 'voxel' (3D pixel). At scales approaching V_P, the smooth continuum picture of space breaks down, and discrete quantum geometry may emerge. In loop quantum gravity, the volume operator has a discrete spectrum with a minimum non-zero eigenvalue related to V_P.
explanation.key_insight: The Planck volume is extraordinarily small—about 10¹⁰⁵ Planck volumes could fit in a single proton! Yet it may represent the fundamental 'atom' of spatial volume in quantum gravity. The observable universe contains roughly 10¹⁸⁵ Planck volumes, giving a finite (though enormous) number of 'spatial atoms.'
explanation.technical_details: Derivation: V_P = ℓ_P³ = (√(Gℏ/c³))³ = (Gℏ/c³)^(3/2). Numerical: V_P = ((6.674×10⁻¹¹)(1.055×10⁻³⁴)/(3×10⁸)³)^(3/2) = (7.04×10⁻⁷⁰)^(3/2) = 4.22×10⁻¹⁰⁵ m³. Dimensional analysis: [G]=[m³/(kg·s²)], [ℏ]=[kg·m²/s], [c]=[m/s]. G^(3/2)ℏ^(3/2)/c^(9/2) → m^(9/2)kg^(-3/2)s^(-3)·kg^(3/2)m³s^(-3/2)·m^(-9/2)s^(9/2) = m³ ✓. Loop quantum gravity: Volume operator eigenvalues V ∝ ℓ_P³ Σ √(j(j+1)(2j+1)) where sum is over vertex intertwiners.
common_misconceptions: WRONG: 'Planck volume is the smallest possible volume' — It's the scale where QG matters, not proven minimum
WRONG: 'Space is made of Planck-volume cubes' — We don't know if space is discrete
WRONG: 'Nothing can be smaller than V_P' — It's a characteristic scale, not hard limit
CORRECT: 'V_P is where classical volume description fails' — Quantum geometry dominates

physical_significance.quantum_gravity: Quantum geometry effects become O(1) at volume scale V_P
physical_significance.holographic_principle: Entropy S ~ A/ℓ_P² = V^(2/3)/ℓ_P² relates volume to information
physical_significance.loop_quantum_gravity: Volume operator has discrete spectrum with gap ~ ℓ_P³

planck_density.significance: Maximum density before black hole formation

planck_energy_density.significance: Maximum energy density; cosmological constant problem

definitions_glossary.planck_volume: V_P = ℓ_P³ ≈ 4.22 × 10⁻¹⁰⁵ m³, the characteristic volume at which quantum gravity dominates
definitions_glossary.volume_operator: In loop quantum gravity, the quantum operator corresponding to spatial volume
definitions_glossary.discrete_spectrum: Eigenvalues form a discrete set rather than a continuous range

related.relationship: Area A_P = ℓ_P²; Volume V_P = ℓ_P³

sources.citation: Rovelli, C. & Vidotto, F. (2014): Covariant Loop Quantum Gravity, Ch. 6: Volume Operator
